trans-unit.source: Windows Live ID as an ACS Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: Windows Live ID as an ACS Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: Windows Live ID as an ACS Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: Windows Live ID as an ACS Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: When a new <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> is created, <token>ms_acct</token> is added as a default identity provider and it cannot be deleted.
trans-unit.target: When a new <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> is created, <token>ms_acct</token> is added as a default identity provider and it cannot be deleted.

trans-unit.source: This functionality enables federated authentication for the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, in which the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal is configured as a relying party application in your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> and <token>windows_live_id</token> is an identity provider that is associated with this relying party application.
trans-unit.target: This functionality enables federated authentication for the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, in which the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal is configured as a relying party application in your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> and <token>windows_live_id</token> is an identity provider that is associated with this relying party application.

trans-unit.source: To prevent loss of access to the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, the <token>windows_live_id</token> identity provider cannot be deleted.
trans-unit.target: To prevent loss of access to the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, the <token>windows_live_id</token> identity provider cannot be deleted.

trans-unit.source: However, in <token>secondref_acs</token>, an identity provider can be associated with more than one relying party application and a relying party application can use multiple identity providers.
trans-unit.target: However, in <token>secondref_acs</token>, an identity provider can be associated with more than one relying party application and a relying party application can use multiple identity providers.

trans-unit.source: Using the ACS Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Using the ACS Management Portal

trans-unit.source: You can use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal to configure the following <token>windows_live_id</token> identity provider settings.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal to configure the following <token>windows_live_id</token> identity provider settings.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Login link text</embeddedLabel>—Specifies the text that is displayed for the <token>windows_live_id</token> identity provider on the login page of your web application.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Login link text</embeddedLabel>—Specifies the text that is displayed for the <token>windows_live_id</token> identity provider on the login page of your web application.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e23d5f14-f36b-478a-935d-b753fa0cf4d0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Login Pages</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e23d5f14-f36b-478a-935d-b753fa0cf4d0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Login Pages</link>.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Image URL (optional)</embeddedLabel>—Specifies the URL to an image file (for example, a logo of your choice) that you can display as the login link for this identity provider.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Image URL (optional)</embeddedLabel>—Specifies the URL to an image file (for example, a logo of your choice) that you can display as the login link for this identity provider.

trans-unit.source: This logo automatically appears on the default login page for your <token>secondref_acs</token>-aware web application, as well as in your web application’s JSON feed that you can use to render a custom login page.
trans-unit.target: This logo automatically appears on the default login page for your <token>secondref_acs</token>-aware web application, as well as in your web application’s JSON feed that you can use to render a custom login page.

trans-unit.source: If you do not specify an image URL, then a text login link for this identity provider is displayed on the login page of your web application.
trans-unit.target: If you do not specify an image URL, then a text login link for this identity provider is displayed on the login page of your web application.

trans-unit.source: If you specify an image URL, it is strongly recommended that it be pointed to a trusted source, for example, your own web site or application, using HTTPS to prevent browser security warnings.
trans-unit.target: If you specify an image URL, it is strongly recommended that it be pointed to a trusted source, for example, your own web site or application, using HTTPS to prevent browser security warnings.

trans-unit.source: Also, any image that is larger than 240 pixels in width and 40 pixels in height is automatically resized on the default ACS home realm discovery page.
trans-unit.target: Also, any image that is larger than 240 pixels in width and 40 pixels in height is automatically resized on the default ACS home realm discovery page.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Relying party application</embeddedLabel>—Specifies all existing relying party applications that you want to associate with <token>windows_live_id</token>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Relying party application</embeddedLabel>—Specifies all existing relying party applications that you want to associate with <token>windows_live_id</token>.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.

trans-unit.source: After an identity provider is associated with a relying party application, rules for that identity provider must be generated or added manually in a relying party application’s rule group to complete the configuration.
trans-unit.target: After an identity provider is associated with a relying party application, rules for that identity provider must be generated or added manually in a relying party application’s rule group to complete the configuration.

trans-unit.source: For more information about creating rules, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about creating rules, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.

trans-unit.source: Supported claim types
trans-unit.target: Supported claim types

trans-unit.source: After a user authenticates with an identity provider, they receive a token that is populated with identity claims.
trans-unit.target: After a user authenticates with an identity provider, they receive a token that is populated with identity claims.

trans-unit.source: Claims are pieces of information about the user, such as an email address or a unique ID.
trans-unit.target: Claims are pieces of information about the user, such as an email address or a unique ID.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> can pass these claims directly through to the relying party application, or make authorization decisions based on the values they contain.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> can pass these claims directly through to the relying party application, or make authorization decisions based on the values they contain.

trans-unit.source: By default, claim types in <token>secondref_acs</token> are uniquely identified using a URI for compliance with the SAML token specification.
trans-unit.target: By default, claim types in <token>secondref_acs</token> are uniquely identified using a URI for compliance with the SAML token specification.

trans-unit.source: These URIs are also used to identify claims in other token formats.
trans-unit.target: These URIs are also used to identify claims in other token formats.

trans-unit.source: The following table shows the claim types that are available to <token>secondref_acs</token> from <token>ms_acct</token>.
trans-unit.target: The following table shows the claim types that are available to <token>secondref_acs</token> from <token>ms_acct</token>.

trans-unit.source: Claim Type
trans-unit.target: Claim Type

trans-unit.source: URI
trans-unit.target: URI

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Name Identifier
trans-unit.target: Name Identifier

trans-unit.source: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/nameidentifier
trans-unit.target: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/nameidentifier

trans-unit.source: A unique identifier for the user account, provided by <token>windows_live_id</token>.
trans-unit.target: A unique identifier for the user account, provided by <token>windows_live_id</token>.

trans-unit.source: Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: http://schemas.microsoft.com/accesscontrolservice/2010/07/claims/IdentityProvider
trans-unit.target: http://schemas.microsoft.com/accesscontrolservice/2010/07/claims/IdentityProvider

trans-unit.source: A claim provided by <token>secondref_acs</token> that tells the relying party application that the user authenticated using the default <token>windows_live_id</token> identity provider.
trans-unit.target: A claim provided by <token>secondref_acs</token> that tells the relying party application that the user authenticated using the default <token>windows_live_id</token> identity provider.

trans-unit.source: The value of this claim is visible in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal via the <ui>Realm</ui> field on the <ui>Edit Identity Provider</ui> page.
trans-unit.target: The value of this claim is visible in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal via the <ui>Realm</ui> field on the <ui>Edit Identity Provider</ui> page.
